intro: Alshehbazia, commonly known as the "scented geranium," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Geraniaceae. These plants are characterized by their aromatic leaves, which emit a pleasant fragrance when crushed. They typically have palmate or lobed leaves and produce small, clustered flowers in shades of pink, red, or white. Alshehbazia species are native to regions of Africa, the Middle East, and southern Asia. They are often cultivated as ornamental plants due to their attractive foliage and fragrant properties.
